title: Blended Learning for Acquiring Motivational Interviewing (MI) Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Communication Skills and Scientific Literacy
context.additional_context: A short-term program in a smartphone-centric learning environment combining theoretical learning and practical sessions to emphasize real-world application skills.

learning_goals: Learners can explain and apply the core principles of motivational interviewing (e.g., empathetic listening, enhancing motivation for change) to situational contexts.
Learners can implement MI (Motivational Interviewing) techniques (e.g., open-ended questions, recognizing change talk) with 80% accuracy or higher in 5-minute simulated counseling videos.
Learners will demonstrate a 30% or greater improvement in MI-based response generation skills in pre-post survey assessments.

resources: Mobile app capable of video recording
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
